title: Actinopterygii
summary: Actinopterygii (/ˌæktɪnɒptəˈrɪdʒiaɪ/; from  actino- 'having rays', and Ancient Greek  πτέρυξ (ptérux) 'wing, fins'), members of which are known as ray-finned fishes, is a clade (traditionally class or subclass) of the bony fishes.[1] They comprise over 50% of living vertebrate species.[2]
